description: Revert all stakes to $2 baseline. Recent $10 stakes are creating outsized losses that overwhelm the 86% win rate
reason: With 86% win rate, a $2 stake yields ~$0.17 avg profit per win but -$2 per loss. At $10 stakes, losses become -$10. Last 7 losses cost -$60 total; at $2 stakes would have cost -$14. The math doesn't work at higher stakes until win rate reaches ~92%+

description: Immediately set Sharbel stake back to $2.00 across all assets (BTC, ETH, SOL)
reason: Memory log from 2/14 9:23PM explicitly flagged stake creep as the root cause of negative P&L despite 86% win rate. Current $5-$10 stakes are amplifying losses. At $2 baseline, same 86% win rate would yield +$15-20 P&L instead of -$16.61. This is not a hypothesis—it's confirmed math from prior analysis.

description: Restrict entries to 80-87% range instead of current 75-92% range
reason: Memory shows 80-90% is sweet spot, but recent data shows losses clustering at 0.81-0.91 entries with high stakes. Narrowing to 80-87% removes the highest-conviction entries where risk/reward is worst (80% win rate but negative P&L per memory). 5 of 7 recent losses were at entries ≥0.81

description: Implement automatic 30-minute pause after 2 consecutive losses (not 3)
reason: Current rule is 3 losses. With $10 stakes, 3 losses = -$30 damage. Lowering threshold to 2 losses provides circuit-breaker protection while data is being collected on the new entry range
